Reviews.Title: “What a Beautiful, Relaxing and well located gem”
Reviews.Author: conelleo
Reviews.Content: I was reccommended by my travel agent to stay at this gem of a hotel located one a quiet residential street. The owner met my wife and family and was totally gracious--in fact, we were four hours late checking in, but he did not mention that. We had a free upgrade to a three bedroom from a Grand Executive, so the children each got a their own room as did my wife and I. The suite decor was so clean and the interior decorating unbelievably co-ordinated. (The owner said his mother does all the suites individually.) Our suite had brand new wooden shutters and everything was so totall clean! We quickly took advantage of using the lovely garden, enjoying an evening galss of wine there. All the things to see and do in Vancouver were so handy to Pendrell Suites, it was perfect for us. English Bay is a five minute walk, Stanley Park maybe eight. The proprietors answered all our questions and recommended which restaurants might interest us. Indeed, Granville Island is but 12 minutes away, including the little ferry there BY FOOT. We received a free tour of the Suite used as Agent Scully's on X-Files--we qualified because we booked for a week--we could not believe how many movies and TV shows had used the place as a locate: over 55, including Chinese Television! If you can get space here, you best do it immediately because it is going global--a huge number of Hollywood movie stars stay here while filming in Vancouver, BTW. In sum, my children have had the experience of a lifetime. My wife and I have enoyed a 5 star property and suite fir the price of a four star one--and I am not counting the movie tour, either. Exceptional. Don't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away, stay far away!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Robbie11
Reviews.Content: The owner did not disclose our room rates and additional charges he intended to charge at time of check in, not to mention being very uncustomer friendly. We made a reservation for a two bedroom suite. When we arrived with our three kids and dog in tow, there was no mention of the extra per-person charge of $30 per night/per person for the three kids, not to mention the extra $20 per day for the dog. The owner said we could park in back, but failed to mention he would charge us $25 a day for that option. It was not until we checked did we find out about the extra charges. When I protested the charges, he said can't you read the website and threatened to call the police Avoid at all cost.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place with Quiet Elegance”
Reviews.Author: I-heart-Travel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as part of our holiday celebrating our 25 year Anniversary. This property was home to many television shows and personalities. We stayed in the Junior Garden Suite and it was anything but Junior. Exapnsive would be more like it. Two full bedrooms, two bathrooms and a full, well stocked kitchen. The property has a large sun patio in the back with a restful water garden. Located one block from Davie Drive with many fine shops and restaurants within walking distance. A MUST for anyone who wants to stay at a place not part of the Cookie Cutter crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay with Large Group”
Reviews.Author: tomas3547
Reviews.Content: Our group reserved three Grand Explorer Suites for a weekend and really enjoyed being there. It was like having our own (enormous) apartments for the weekend in a charming, quiet, and safe neighborhood close to Robson shopping, English Bay and the parade of Denman- left to our own devices, with full run of the beautiful garden and all this awesome neighborhood has to offer. Boyd oriented us really well to all the amenities there and nearby shopping, etc. Truly a sweet spot; would go back in a minute. Charming, clean, comfortable and - best of all - genuinely unique to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Goods and bads”
Reviews.Author: chavgopal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3-night stay at the Pendrell Suites. The suite was wonderful (clean, large, etc.) and the building itself is in a very nice location. It is very near the park and a funky area with lots of shops and restaurants. No complaints about the physical set-up. On the negative side, it was quite expensive -- and there was no housekeeping. Make your own beds, wash your own dishes and reuse the towels. I am not sure whether this is a once-a-week kind of housekeeping set-up or what, but we paid a lot of dough for no service whatsoever. We won't be staying there again. There are less expensive nice places in town with fresher towels.

Reviews.Title: “Would never return!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were so miserable here that we thought about turning around and going home within the first 24 hours. We had communicated with the management a lot before we arrived. Specifically we wanted to be away from any construction during our stay, so we looked carefully at our options. We were assured there was no nearby construction. We got to our suite, I opened the kitchen window and 3 feet away the building next door was being completely renovated. We listened to saws and nail guns every day! The owner said he forgot the place next door was under construction! We stayed in their "nicest suite" - this translated to mold, mildew, plastic covered mattresses, horribly stained carpet, worn out furniture, and decor from the 1980's (at best!). We didn't even unpack our clothes because the dresser looked like something from Salvation Army! The floors creaked and we heard every foot step (and bump and suitcase wheel) from the place above us. Window coverings were inadequate so street lights poured in. The blender and blow dryer were so old they still had double prong plugs (no third grounding post), and the blender was filthy, as well as having a frayed cord. We found dried food on dishes and cutting boards. The owner was never available so we were stuck to communicate with none English speaking staff. When we had to leave a day earlier than planned due to family illness, the owner charged us for the extra day. There is no service to bring you more towels (and, believe me, you only get the bare minimum), washclothes, kitchen towels. So, you call and hope someone is around. The parking is terrible. And there is no trash receptacle outside - I have no idea where our trash was supposed to go. There were no recycling bins. And the heat in the rooms is unpredictable. One of our rooms was so hot, we turned the heat off - but it never went off! We finally had to open a window just to cool off. This place is not maintained, not kept clean, and not into any kind of customer service. The owner tries to make it look like he's being very personal by having a printed welcome letter with your name on it when you arrive. But that's about all you'll ever see of personal service. Oh, we had a fax machine with no paper in it, too. Forget the fax I was supposed to get! This owner is more interested in his "X Files" Tours (I guess that how the place got popular is the filming of part of that show there). When we arrived we couldn't speak with him (about the construction) because he was busy setting up an X Files Reunion. It's hard to find accomodations with more than one or two bedrooms (we checked everywhere) - we found our choices to be limited to The Meridian and the Lord Stanley. Maybe we would have been better off at one of those! I definitely say take this one off your list. Or bring you own appliances, dishes, towels, ear plugs, allergy medicine and mattress!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: LesterB
Reviews.Content: Made a spur of the moment business trip to Vancouver, the company travel agent made our reservations at Pendrell Suites. PS is a lovely apartment building in a leafy Vancouver neighborhood. When the housekeeper showed me upstairs I was confounded, I thought she was showing me to a bedroom and could not believe that she meant the whole place was for us! We had 3 bedrooms, 2 baths, a giant gleaming kitchen, a formal dining room, big living room, 2 fireplaces; THIS APARTMENT WAS BIGGER THAN OUR HOUSE! It is all hardwood floors, the building is old and charming! Absolutiely spotless, well equipped, tons of restaurants and shopping within walking distance. Many movies and TV shows were filmed in this building, including the X-Files. It was all a delightful surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my Wedding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband booked our whole wedding party into this fantastic, little hotel right downtown! The suites were huge and we had friends and family right around us. Close to Robson, English Bay and all those places. Exceptional service, and they also got us married in Japanese style! Only problem, it is so busy you might not get in as soon as you want--we saw it on TV!

Reviews.Title: “So special I wanted to by my Pendrell Suite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What an incredible stay I had at this darling, boutique hotel in Vancouver in late September. My five friends (women) stayed for four days and had the most wonderful time. We were in a Grand Ex-something suite, which was large, bigger than my house, I think. Also, it was so quiet in the neighborhood, but then we cou all trip out to see Yaletown, Robson and other shopping areas. I wanted to purchase our unit after the first night, but they're not for sale--and I can see why. Staff were prompt, courteous and attentive to detail. We were met by the owner and given a thorough briefing on what to do and where to go. All the restaurant recommendations were spot on. My advice is to fo there, if you can get in. (There were guests from New York, Japan, Germany and Los Angeles when we were there--they wouldn't tell me the name of the actress staying there at the time, darn!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful suite!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at "the Suites" and it was wonderful. Tranquil. Enjoyed the easy access. Loved the attention from Boyd and Rosemary. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Pendrell Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I just spent a glorious week at Pendrell Suites in Vancouver. I'm not one to write reviews, but our time was so superb that it merits kudos. My wife tended to the kinds, who had their own bedroom and I even got work done on my laptop--fastes hotel internet connection I've ever had on their network! The owner, Rosemary, along with her son, Boyd, were great hosts. The maid made sure there were more towels when the kids went through them too fast. Location of the place is close to all of what we wanted to see in Vancouver: Stnley Park, Robson Street and English Bay. Boyd knew everything so it didn't bother me to call him when I need inforamtion on hoew to get to Victoria Island. I wanted to buy our unit, but they're not for sale. However, that's probably the best way to share this treasure--which I only found out about from a friend who had been there last year. Don't miss this one. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We read the couple of bad reviews of the Pendrell Suites (PS) on this site while we were planning our trip to Vancouver. The negative comments made us a little wary, but we decided to give PS a shot anyway. There is not worse than spending a great vacation in a bad hotel. During our three days at the PS, we did not experience any of the negative comments posted on this site. In fact, I wonder if the reviewers even stayed at the PS. The suite we stayed in was immaculately clean. I am not just referring to the bathrooms or the kitchen: I am a referring to the entire suite, including the baseboards, hardwood floors, windows, garden, etc. Regarding the unaccomadating comment posted, we also have to disagree. The owner/manager provided us with excellent service. He even gave us some great restaurant recommendations and was 4 for 4. The PS is very conviently located as well. In short, I cannot think of anything that we experienced during our stay that was anything short of exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this facility. The management is rude and completely unaccomodating. The service is minimal and the mold and mildew in the buliding is horrible.

Reviews.Title: “A Sweet Suite!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: loved it! It was spacious and while a little pricey it was worth it for what i wanted.
